item.title: Ticket #2657 (No way to show next 20 comments in edit-comments.php) updated
item.dc:creator: rwh
item.description: Added patch (edit-comments.php.diff) which implements next/previous links for editing and viewing comments in edit-comments.php. Note that another bug was fixed where the offset in the ordered list was off by 1.

item.title: edit-comments.php.diff attached to Ticket #2657
item.dc:creator: rwh

item.title: Ticket #2657 (No way to show next 20 comments in edit-comments.php) created
item.dc:creator: rwh
item.description: When editing comments, it is only possible to view the latest 20 comments. We need to add links to the next/previous page of comments.

item.title: Ticket #2651 (404.php not implemented with different permalink structure) updated
item.dc:creator: mikeleeorg
item.description:
I just posted a report on this bug to the forum, at:
​http://wordpress.org/support/topic/68607

It includes steps to reproduce it as well. My dump_env feedback, which I created with all plugins deactivated and the default theme selected, is here:
​http://mikelee.org/dump_env.html (view the source of page)

To see the 404 error I'm currently receiving, visit:
​http://www.mikelee.org/404

Currently, the plugins I'm using are:

  • ​Yahoo/MSN Style Smileys
  • ​Links-NoFollow
  • ​Unfancy Quote

Please let me know if I can provide any more info. From what I've seen at the forum, there seem to be a number of users facing this bug. If there's any way I can persuade you to raise its priority, please let me know! Thanks!

item.title: Ticket #2656 (options.php mangles options with apostrophes in the value) updated
item.dc:creator: skeltoac
item.description:
Keywords changed

The attached patch encodes apostrophes. Works nicely for me.

item.title: options-escape-quotes.diff attached to Ticket #2656
item.dc:creator: skeltoac

item.title: Ticket #2656 (options.php mangles options with apostrophes in the value) updated
item.dc:creator: skeltoac

item.title: Ticket #2656 (options.php mangles options with apostrophes in the value) created
item.dc:creator: skeltoac
item.description: On display, the apostrophe is unescaped, so the value attribute is truncated. On save, the truncated value is saved. This really plays hell with serialized arrays when one of the members has an apostrophe in it.

item.title: Ticket #2648 (PHPdoc effort for /wp-includes/comment-functions.php) updated

item.title: Ticket #2655 (Widget configuration box titlebar inaccessible with large box) updated
item.dc:creator: rabin
item.description: The patch modifies popControl() to check if the x or y is negative, and if so, set them to zero before setting the css properties of the div.

item.title: widgets.patch attached to Ticket #2655
item.dc:creator: rabin

item.title: Ticket #2655 (Widget configuration box titlebar inaccessible with large box) created
item.dc:creator: rabin
item.description:
In the Sidebar Arrangment panel, when a widget's configuration box is suitably large, the configuration box div is placed such that its titlebar is out of the client area (top < 0). Thus the box cannot be moved or closed.

This is with the widgets.php from SVN.

item.title: Ticket #2651 (404.php not implemented with different permalink structure) reopened
item.dc:creator: sluggo
item.description: I changed to default theme, disabled all plugins, same problem. I installed the dump plugin and posted the results to ​http://www.unknown.nu/temp/dump.html.

item.title: Ticket #2654 (Why not store dbx states in usermeta?) updated
item.dc:creator: ringmaster
item.description:
You're adding 40+ lines of code and additional client/server ajax calls to store per-user open states and positions of the boxes on the Write page that work just fine when stored in cookies (if slightly inconvenient for people who don't always use the same terminal). That seems like a reason not to include this.

If you're looking to implement something with Ajax, here's an idea:

Ditch tw-sack (No error handling/debugging? Can't handle equals signs as passed values with the standard functions?) and build a WP-pluggable ajax library. Move all of the floating PHP functions that respond to the various ajax requests into a single file that dispatches those requests to plugin hooks. Include some way to hook client-side events to server-side code on-demand so that things like this can be customized by plugins.

My $2. Inflation, don't ya know.

item.title: dbx-usermeta.diff attached to Ticket #2654
item.dc:creator: skeltoac

item.title: Ticket #2654 (Why not store dbx states in usermeta?) created
